page.title: 11Langtoft Parish Church
page.content: Langtoft Church is called{St.Peter's, Langtoft and is a Church of England church.It stands on a high part of the village and overlooks most of the houses.It contains a{Saxon Font}that was brought from Cottam church,which is now disused and is due for demolition in the near future.The present Vicar is Rev. Colin Lenton who was appointed in 1985.The Vicarage is now a modern house on Scarborough Road but until 1984 it was a Victorian house which is close to the church. The church was greatly restored at the turn of the century at the expense of Sir Tatton Sykes.Much of the intricate woodwork dates from that time. In the square shaped tower are the {church bells.}There are two bells;one dates from{1620}and the other from {1953.}The church and the cemetery are surrounded by a shelter belt of trees.
